main event: Seven round lights were observed in the sky over Oklahoma City, Oklahoma on March 30, 1967.
interesting points: The objects appeared to travel at twice the speed of common jet aircraft.
The objects changed color from red to white and back to red, flashing or pulsating.
The objects were first observed at an elevation of 39 degrees, with some objects in different locations in the sky.
The objects gradually disappeared to the north after being visible for 2-3 minutes each.
The weather conditions included windy, damp weather with scattered clouds and good visibility.
sighted object: seven round lights in the sky
